titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Robin William Winks Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:03

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings,and audiotapes documenting the personal life and professional career of Robin William Winks.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Robin Winks, pre-1987-1993, 2000, 2001; gift of Avril Winks, 2004.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Office files and Miscellaneous recommendations, New Haven Colony Historical Society, Fulbright in Accession 2001-M-019 and all of Accessions 2002-M-011 and 2004-M-060 are unprocessed and may contain sensitive information or be in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu requesting specific box numbers in order to initiate the review process, which may take several weeks.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robin William Winks Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robin William Evert Winks was born in Indiana on December 5, 1930. He graduated from the University of Colorado in 1952 and received an M.A. in Maori studies from Victoria University as a Fulbright Scholar in New Zealand. He received his Ph.D. from Johns Hopkins in 1957. Winks joined Yale's history department in 1957, serving as its chairman from 1996 to 1999. From 1999 to 2000, he was the Vyvyan Harmsworth visiting professor of American history at Oxford University. He was a prolific author and in 1987 published Cloak & Gown: Scholars in America's Secret War, an account of the Central Intelligence Agency's relationship with major American universities. Winks died in New Haven, Connecticut, on April 7, 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings,and audiotapes documenting the personal life and professional career of Robin William Winks.

did.unittitle: Council on International Exchange of Scholars
Blueprints of the main building at Ellis Island, Statue of Library National Monument, New York/New Jersey
Blueprints of the restoration of the Statue of Liberty, prepared for the French-American Committee for Restoration of the Statue of Liberty, Inc.
Minutes of the Statue of Liberty-Ellis Island Centennial Commission
"History of New Haven Parks," as developed by the Parks Board
Association for Canadian Studies in the United States-Bro (general)
National Endowment for the Humanities-Oxford University Press
Material on James Grafton Rogers from the Colorado Historical Society
Material on Yale Library project from the University of Illinois Archives

unittitle.title: Reminiscences of a Varied Life [unbound copy of Sherman Kent's autobiography; introduction by Robin W. Winks with accompanying correspondence of Anthony Arnold, Kent's nephew; 3 folders]

did.unittitle: "A Title Oscillation: Journal of Comparative Neurology and Psychology , 1904-1910," by Randall D. Wight, Journal of Comparative Neurology , 314:34-36
Primarily postcards of the Winks family [Avril, Honor, Eliot, E. M.]

unittitle.title: Oxford History of the British Empire; topical files

did.unittitle: National Parks and Conservation Association [includes reports, board of trustees and executive committee briefing books, correspondence, memoranda, and background files on the National Park Service]
National Park Service Act of 1916 [background files, copies of related federal legislation, correspondence, and audio and cassette tapes]
Yale University files [re: Studies in the Environment program]
National Park Service files [correspondence, program proposals, and federal policies]
National Parks and Conservation Association [briefing books and correspondence]
Marsh-Billings National Historical Park [publications and brochures]
Research notes for his unpublished biography of William Francis Drummond Jervois
Conference presentations and lectures [audio tapes and cassettes]
